headline: What Analysts Think Is Changing the Story for IBM and Its Edge Over Competitors
summary: International Business Machines has seen a modest upward revision to its fair value estimate, nudged from roughly $290.89 to $293.89 as analysts factor in steadier long term revenue growth expectations and a slightly higher required return in their models. This small adjustment reflects a balanced view that IBM's emerging strengths in software, consulting, and quantum can offset ongoing execution risks, supporting a cautiously constructive stance on the stock's narrative. Read on to see how...

headline: IBM and Pearson Team Up on AI-Powered Learning
summary: International Business Machines Corporation (NYSE:IBM) is included among the 12 Best Dogs of the Dow to Invest in. IBM and Pearson announced on December 11 that they are teaming up on a global partnership focused on AI-powered learning. The goal is to build more personalized learning tools for businesses, public-sector groups, and schools. These products […]

headline: Wolters Kluwer CCH® Tagetik achieves IBM Cloud for Financial Services® Validated designation
summary: NEW YORK, December 17, 2025--Wolters Kluwer today announced that its CCH Tagetik Intelligent Platform has obtained the IBM Cloud for Financial Services Validated designation. The IBM Cloud for Financial Services framework is designed to help institutions mitigate risk and accelerate innovation by ensuring solutions adhere to stringent regulatory and security standards.

headline: 2 Reasons IBM is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: While the S&P 500 is up 13.9% since June 2025, IBM (currently trading at $302.81 per share) has lagged behind, posting a return of 7%. This might have investors contemplating their next move.
